channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8328619] sun/management/jmxremote/bootstrap/SSLConfigFilePermissionTest.java failed with BindException: Address already in use
item.description:
The following test failed in the JDK23 CI:

sun/management/jmxremote/bootstrap/SSLConfigFilePermissionTest.java

Here's a snippet from the log file:

#section:main

reason: User specified action: run main/timeout=300 SSLConfigFilePermissionTest

Mode: agentvm

finished: Wed Mar 20 05:06:27 UTC 2024
elapsed time (seconds): 7.287
----------configuration:(17/2132)----------

<snip>

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This test was update included not requiring to match the space after "Exception thrown by the agent".
BUT in 21, that space is still there, e.g.

Error: Exception thrown by the agent : java.rmi.server.ExportException: Port already in use: 37877; nested exception is:
java.net.BindException: Address already in use

This message comes from:

cat -vet src/jdk.management.agent/share/classes/jdk/internal/agent/resources/agent.properties
...shows:
agent.err.exception = Exception thrown by the agent $


In latest jdk:
agent.err.exception = Exception thrown by the agent$


This trailing whitespace was removed by:
8298046: Fix hidden but significant trailing whitespace in properties files for serviceability code

Without 8298046 in 21u, the test change backport has caused a problem.
Backporting 8298046 would put the test in sync again with the error message.

Fix request [17u,21u]

I backport this for parity with 21.0.7-oracle, applies to 17, too.
No risk, only a test change
Clean backport.
Test passes. SAP nightly testing passed.

Test checks for:
!output.getOutput().contains("Exception thrown by the agent : java.rmi.server.ExportException: Port already in use")

Oops, we have an extra space in there. A day-one typo from JDK-7195249.
